isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - PRO SLEEPER ELECTRICAL SYSTEM - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - MANUAL SLEEPER TEMPERATURE CONTROLS (STANDARD)

svcprocinfo.para: The manual temperature control system includes three components:

svcsubproc.title: TEMPERATURE CONTROL POTENTIOMETER (592)
svcsubproc.para:
See Figure 5 Manual Temperature Controls (Summer Setting)
- With the key switch ON, positive battery power from Auxiliary Blower Relay (147) terminal 87 goes through Winter/Summer switch (591) terminal 6-5, then through connector (592) terminal A to the temperature control potentiometer. Temperature control potentiometer connector (592) terminal C is ground and terminal B provides a variable wiper signal to the Flat Pack to control damper position.
Fully Open Damper Position - A signal of 2 volts or less at connector (592) terminal B will cause the damper to go to a full open position.
Fully Closed Damper Position -A signal of 11 volts or more will cause the damper to go to a full closed position.

Partially Open Damper Positions -A signal at terminal B between 2 and 11 volts will position the damper in partially open position, ranging from mostly open (slightly more than 2 volts) to mostly closed (slightly less than 11 volts).

Turning the Temperature Control Knob clockwise as far as it goes ( Figure 6 , View B), causes the pointer to move to a position of minimum resistance between positive terminal A and signal terminal B, resulting in a signal of 11 volts or more at terminal B, causing the damper to completely close.

Turning the control knob counter-clockwise as far as it goes ( Figure 5, view A), causes the pointer to move to a position of maximum resistancebetween positive terminal A and signal terminal B, resulting in a signal of 2 volts or less, causing the damper to move to a full open position.

See Figure 7 - With the key switch in the On or Acc position, positive battery power from Auxiliary Blower Relay (147) terminal 87 goes through Winter/Summer switch (591) terminal 1-2, then through connector (592) terminal C to the temperature control potentiometer. Temperature control potentiometer connector (592) terminal A is ground and terminal B provides a variable signal to the Flat Pack to control damper position.
Fully Open Damper Position -A signal of 2 volts or less at connector (592) terminal B will cause the damper to go to a full open position.
Fully Closed Damper Position -A signal of 11 volts or more will cause the damper to go to a full closed position.

Partially Open Damper Positions -A signal at terminal B between 2 and 11 volts will position the damper in partially open position, ranging from mostly open (slightly more than 2 volts) to mostly closed (slightly less than 11 volts).

Turning the Temperature Control Knob clockwise as far as it goes ( Figure 8 , view B), causes the pointer to move to a position of maximum resistance between the positive terminal C and terminal B, resulting in a signal of 2 volts or less at terminal B, causing the damper to completely open.

Turning the control knob counter-clockwise as far as it goes ( Figure 8 , view A), causes the pointer to move to a position of minimum resistance between positive terminal C and terminal B, resulting in a signal of 11 volts or more at terminal B, causing the damper to move to a fully closed position.

svcsubproc.title: WINTER/SUMMER SWITCH
svcsubproc.para: The purpose of the this switch is to reverse the polarity of the feed and ground circuits to the temperature control potentiometer. This is done so that the temperature control knob moved clockwise (turned into red area) will indicate a call for more heat (winter position), or less air conditioning (summer position). If the knob is turned counter-clockwise, it indicates a call for less heat (winter position), or more cooling (summer position).
